home.title: Your Health Journey Starts Here
home.hero_title: Welcome to Your New Healthcare Home
home.hero_subtitle: We help refugees and immigrants navigate the healthcare system with confidence. Available in your language.
home.feature1_desc: Understand how healthcare works in your new country
home.feature2_desc: Access everything in the language you're most comfortable with
home.feature3_desc: Keep track of appointments, medications, and health information
home.feature4_desc: Connect with community resources and support services
home.step1_desc: Complete our onboarding to understand the healthcare system
home.step2_desc: Use your dashboard to manage appointments and medications
home.step3_desc: Access resources and take charge of your health
home.cta_subtitle: Learn about your healthcare rights and resources in just a few minutes

onboarding.title: Getting Started
onboarding.welcome_desc: We'll help you understand how healthcare works and what resources are available to you.
onboarding.learn_system_desc: Understand different types of healthcare facilities
onboarding.get_help_desc: Find resources and support in your community
onboarding.system_desc: There are different types of healthcare facilities for different needs.
onboarding.primary_care_desc: Your main doctor for regular checkups and common health issues.
onboarding.urgent_care_desc: For issues that need quick attention but aren't emergencies.
onboarding.urgent_example3: When your doctor is not available
onboarding.emergency_example3: Signs of stroke or heart attack
onboarding.insurance_desc: There are several ways to get health coverage in the United States.
onboarding.medicaid_desc: Free or low-cost health coverage for eligible individuals and families.
onboarding.marketplace_desc: Shop for private health insurance plans, many with financial help.
onboarding.community_health_desc: Provide care regardless of ability to pay or insurance status.
onboarding.rights_desc: You have important rights when it comes to healthcare.
onboarding.right_interpreter_desc: You have the right to a free interpreter at healthcare facilities. You do not have to bring your own.
onboarding.right_nodiscrim_desc: Healthcare providers cannot refuse to treat you based on your race, national origin, religion, or immigration status.
onboarding.right_privacy_desc: Your health information is protected. Providers cannot share it without your permission.
onboarding.right_emergency_desc: Emergency rooms must treat you regardless of your ability to pay or insurance status.
onboarding.right_records_desc: You can request copies of your medical records at any time.
onboarding.profile_desc: This information helps us personalize your experience. All information is private and secure.
onboarding.form_conditions_placeholder: Any health conditions we should know about? (optional)
onboarding.complete_desc: You've completed the onboarding. You're now ready to use your health dashboard.
onboarding.learned1: Types of healthcare facilities and when to use them
onboarding.learned2: Health coverage options available to you
onboarding.next_steps_desc: Visit your dashboard to track appointments, medications, and access more resources.

dashboard.title: Health Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Your personal health management center
dashboard.checkin_success: Check-in recorded! Take care of yourself.
dashboard.tip1_desc: Drink 8 glasses of water daily for better health and energy.
dashboard.tip2_desc: Try to walk for 30 minutes each day. It helps your body and mind.
dashboard.tip3_desc: Adults need 7-9 hours of sleep each night for optimal health.

health_info.title: Health Information
health_info.subtitle: Learn about preventive care, mental health, and more
health_info.find_doctor_intro: Here's how to find a primary care doctor:
health_info.find_step1: Check if you have health insurance and find doctors in your network
health_info.find_step2: Search for community health centers in your area
health_info.find_step3: Ask for recommendations from friends or community organizations
health_info.find_step4: Call to make sure they accept your insurance and speak your language
health_info.appointment_intro: Here's what to bring to your appointment:
health_info.bring_id: Photo ID (driver's license, passport, or other ID)
health_info.bring_medications: List of all medications you take
health_info.bring_questions: List of questions for your doctor
health_info.bring_records: Any medical records from previous doctors
health_info.interpreter_text: You have the right to a free interpreter. When you make an appointment, tell them what language you speak. You can also say this phrase:
health_info.interpreter_phrase: I need an interpreter in [your language], please.
health_info.screen_physical_desc: A yearly checkup with your doctor
health_info.screen_dental_desc: Visit a dentist twice a year
health_info.screen_vaccines_desc: Stay up to date on recommended vaccines
health_info.habit_nutrition_desc: Include fruits, vegetables, and whole grains in your diet.
health_info.habit_exercise_desc: Aim for 30 minutes of physical activity most days.
health_info.habit_sleep_desc: Get 7-9 hours of sleep each night.
health_info.mental_intro: Mental health is just as important as physical health. It's okay to ask for help.
health_info.common_feelings_intro: Moving to a new country can bring many feelings:
health_info.feeling_anxiety: Anxiety or worry about the future
health_info.sign1: Feeling sad or hopeless most days
health_info.sign2: Difficulty sleeping or sleeping too much
health_info.sign3: Loss of interest in things you used to enjoy
health_info.sign4: Thoughts of hurting yourself or others
health_info.women_pap_desc: Screens for cervical cancer. Recommended starting at age 21.
health_info.women_mammogram_desc: Breast cancer screening. Recommended starting at age 40-50.
health_info.women_prenatal_desc: Regular checkups during pregnancy are very important.
health_info.pregnancy_intro: If you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant:
health_info.preg_tip1: Start prenatal care as early as possible
health_info.preg_tip2: Take prenatal vitamins with folic acid
health_info.preg_tip3: WIC program provides free nutrition support
health_info.child_checkups_intro: Regular checkups help ensure your child is growing and developing well.
health_info.vaccinations_intro: Vaccines protect your child from serious diseases.
health_info.vaccine_free: Children can get free vaccines through the Vaccines for Children (VFC) program.
health_info.school_health_intro: Make sure your child is ready for school:
health_info.school_tip3: Inform school of any health conditions or allergies

appointments.title: Appointments
appointments.subtitle: Keep track of your medical appointments
appointments.notes_placeholder: Any notes or things to remember
appointments.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this appointment?
appointments.tip1: Arrive 15 minutes early to fill out paperwork
appointments.tip2: Bring your insurance card and ID
appointments.tip3: Write down questions for your doctor beforehand
appointments.tip4: Ask for an interpreter when you make the appointment

medications.title: Medications
medications.subtitle: Track your medications and dosages
medications.name: Medication Name
medications.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this medication?
medications.safety3: Store medications in a cool, dry place
medications.safety5: Tell your doctor about all medications you take
medications.pharmacy_intro: If you need help understanding your medication, you can ask:
medications.pharmacy_phrase: Can you explain how to take this medication?

emergency.title: Emergency Information
emergency.subtitle: Know what to do in an emergency
emergency.chest_pain_desc: Pain or pressure in your chest, especially with shortness of breath
emergency.stroke_desc: Face drooping, arm weakness, speech difficulty
emergency.breathing_desc: Severe shortness of breath or choking
emergency.injury_desc: Broken bones, severe burns, head injuries
emergency.unconscious_desc: Person is unresponsive or having a seizure
emergency.fast_intro: Use FAST to recognize stroke symptoms:
emergency.fast_f_desc: Ask the person to smile. Does one side droop?
emergency.fast_a_desc: Ask them to raise both arms. Does one drift down?
emergency.fast_s_desc: Ask them to repeat a simple phrase. Is speech slurred?
emergency.fast_t_desc: If you see any signs, call 911 immediately!
emergency.phrases_intro: Important phrases to know in English:
emergency.phrase_help_meaning: Use when you need immediate assistance
emergency.phrase_ambulance_meaning: Use when someone needs emergency medical transport
emergency.phrase_interpreter_meaning: Use when you need language assistance
emergency.phrase_address_meaning: Tell them where you are so help can find you

resources.title: Community Resources
resources.subtitle: Find help and support in your community
resources.translation_intro: You have the right to language assistance:
resources.hospital_interpreters_desc: All hospitals must provide free interpreter services
resources.phone_interpreters_desc: Many clinics offer phone interpretation in 200+ languages
resources.document_translation_desc: Important medical documents should be translated for you
resources.transportation_intro: Getting to appointments can be challenging. Here are options:
resources.medicaid_transport_desc: If you have Medicaid, you may qualify for free rides to medical appointments
resources.public_transit_desc: Buses and trains can be affordable options. Ask about reduced fare programs
resources.volunteer_drivers_desc: Some organizations offer free rides with volunteer drivers
resources.financial_intro: Healthcare costs can be managed with these programs:
resources.sliding_scale_desc: Community health centers charge based on your income
resources.charity_care_desc: Many hospitals have programs to reduce or eliminate bills for those who qualify
resources.prescription_help_desc: Programs exist to help with medication costs
resources.counseling_desc: Individual and family counseling with culturally sensitive providers
resources.support_groups_desc: Connect with others who understand your experience
resources.fqhc_desc: Provide care regardless of ability to pay
resources.free_clinics_desc: Volunteer-run clinics offering free basic healthcare
resources.mobile_clinics_desc: Healthcare services that come to your neighborhood
resources.refugee_intro: Organizations that help refugees and immigrants:
resources.resettlement_desc: Help with housing, employment, and healthcare navigation
resources.cultural_orgs_desc: Community groups that provide support in your language
resources.women_children_intro: Special programs for mothers and children:
resources.wic_desc: Free nutrition support for pregnant women and young children
resources.chip_desc: Health insurance for children whose families don't qualify for Medicaid
resources.food_banks_desc: Free groceries for families in need
resources.snap_desc: Monthly benefits to buy food at grocery stores
resources.meals_programs_desc: Free meals at community centers and schools
resources.find_help_intro: Use these resources to find services in your area:

footer.about_text: HealthBridge helps refugees and immigrants navigate the healthcare system and access the care they need.
